applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for the following reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operation and governance of a pension death benefit scheme. It does not deal with the payment of fees, commissions, or rewards to intermediaries or other parties. 2) The document specifically states it is about providing benefits to dependants in the event of a member's death before retirement age through a trust structure. 3) While AIB Life is mentioned as the life office and registered administrator, the document does not contain any provisions about paying commissions or fees to third parties for regulated activities. 4) The financial arrangements described in the document are limited to premium payments from employers and benefit payments to beneficiaries, not intermediary compensation. 5) The regulation in question (Section 48, Regulation 20) specifically governs who can receive fees/commissions for providing regulated activities, which is not a subject matter covered in these scheme rules.
regulation_title: Fees, commissions, rewards (etc.) permitted to be paid or provided to certain persons only
regulation_text: 20. A regulated entity may pay or provide a fee, commission, other reward or remuneration in respect of the provision of regulated activities only to a person that is any of the following: (a) a regulated entity; (b) a certified person; (c) an individual for whom a regulated entity has taken full and unconditional responsibility under the Investment Intermediaries Act 1995; (d) an agent, branch or entity to which activities are outsourced in accordance with the European Union (Payment Services) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 6 of 2018) where the regulated entity remains fully liable for the acts of that agent, branch or entity to which activities are outsourced; (e) a distributor, agent, branch or entity to which activities are outsourced in accordance with the European Communities (Electronic Money) Regulations 2011 where the regulated entity remains fully liable for the acts of that distributor, agent, branch or entity to which activities are outsourced; (f) a person that is specifically exempted by law from a requirement to hold an authorisation, licence or registration to carry out the regulated activity in respect of which the fee, commission, other reward or remuneration is paid; (g) a credit intermediary within the meaning of the Act of 1995 and the European Communities (Consumer Credit Agreements) Regulations 2010; (h) a person that is no longer providing a regulated activity, but the fee, commission, other reward or remuneration is paid in respect of a regulated activity that the person provided when the person was a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (g ). 42 [81]
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
